string.text:
A worn wallet made from leather for storing banknotes and coins. Inside, it has multiple compartments for cash, identification cards, and smaller miscellaneous items. The outside is scuffed and the stitching is frayed in places. It appears to have been handed down from multiple previous owners. As trade using barter items and physical currency still remains the norm in the Zone, durable wallets remain widely used.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] personal belongings
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] currency storage

A loose assortment of rouble coins, the officially recognized currency of the Russian Federation. The rouble's history traces back to the 14th century, making it one of the oldest continuously used currencies in the world. Modern roubles are composed of paper banknotes and metallic coins, each bearing the emblem of the Russian Federation and intricate designs that reflect significant cultural and historical landmarks. In the Zone, the rouble remains the standard medium of exchange, besides direct bartering.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable item
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] universal currency
